properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 2:31AM CST until February 14 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Aberdeen SD
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected.
Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory,
very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero.

* WHERE...Roberts, Grant and Deuel Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 8 AM this morning
to 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 7
AM CST this morning.

* IMPACTS...Patchy blowing snow could lead to reduced visibility.
Blowing snow may also refreeze on road surfaces during the day,
leading to icy conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact
the morning and evening commute. The dangerously cold wind
chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10
minutes.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING
